Blog.post: urlLink My first sketch in my art blog! Yay! Unfortunately, it isn't a very happy subject.
urlLink Ha. I am a mantis. I will eat you.
urlLink This was one of the other ants. This one didn't try to eat Andrew's arm off.
urlLink Black-eyes Susans. I love 'em. More fun at Powell Gardens.
urlLink Super mutt! Look at him fly! Too bad the picture's kind of blurry...
urlLink Surprise lily. This lily was even more surprised when it was mowed...heh heh.
urlLink I had to use max zoom on my camera to get a picture of this guy, as well as chase him through the meadow for five minutes until he found a nice spot to hang out.
urlLink This is Samwise, my dog. He's the sweetest critter ever!
urlLink My husband, being eaten by a giant ant. Probably the coolest picture of the day. Powell Gardens.
urlLink Weird buggy bee critter. Powell Gardens. I think it's a bee. It's a buzzy something. There were a lot of buzzy somethings out there.

urlLink Mackay Hall. Always dark and foreboding for some reason. Maybe it's just because I went to school here... Or maybe because it's haunted . Yes, I went to a haunted school. Half the buildings are haunted. The original Chapel burned down on Christmas Eve in the very early 1900s. There was a pyro student on campus who successfully burned down Alumni Hall, needlesstosay the thought crossed my mind occasionally while I was a student there. Plus, we have this really nice clock tower as you can see. Anyway, I climbed onto the roof of this building when I was a freshman there. Me and two other guys in class. We were told to not do that anymore.

urlLink Cicada Killer from Powell Gardens. This is as close as I got to the thing... Pretty sure Cicada Killer = Hornet or Cicada Killer = Bee of some sort or Cicada Killer = Buzzy, stinging pain. Don't care for insects. There were tons of these critters in one part of the garden. And this cute little sign that said something along the lines of "Don't mind our bugs." I will mind your bugs if I damn well please, thank you very much. But at least this one is kinda famous now.
